faqSection.title: Common Questions About How to Rent House in Sector 106
faqSection.description: Find detailed, practical answers to the most frequent queries tenants have about independent house rentals, lease agreements, and local amenities in Sector 106 Gurgaon.

faqs.question: What is the typical rental cost range for a builder floor in Sector 106
faqs.answer: The rental costs are highly dependent on the size, furnishing level, and exact location within Sector 106. Generally, a modern 3 BHK builder floor can range from INR 25,000 to INR 45,000 per month. Larger, fully-furnished units or luxury independent houses on 10 Marla plots or above can command rents starting from INR 60,000 and reaching well over INR 1,20,000 depending on the specifications and amenities provided to the tenant.

faqs.question: Are independent houses available for rent usually furnished or unfurnished
faqs.answer: You will find a mix of options when you look to Rent House in Sector 106. Most builder floors and independent houses are offered in a semi-furnished condition, which typically includes modular kitchens, wardrobes, and light fixtures. However, there is a growing trend of fully-furnished luxury villas targeted at expatriates or senior executives, which come equipped with all white goods and premium furniture.

faqs.question: What is the standard lease term for residential properties in Sector 106 Gurgaon
faqs.answer: The standard residential lease agreement in this sector is typically for 11 months, renewable upon mutual agreement. However, for large independent houses or premium luxury rentals, landlords often prefer a minimum lock-in period of 12 months, followed by a contractual renewal period of up to three years, ensuring stability for both parties involved in the tenancy agreement.

faqs.question: How much is the security deposit required when renting a house here
faqs.answer: For independent house rentals in Sector 106, the standard security deposit is equivalent to two months of the agreed-upon monthly rent. This amount is refundable at the end of the tenancy period, provided the property is returned without major damage beyond normal wear and tear. Some high-end properties might require up to three months rent as security.

faqs.question: Is Sector 106 Gurgaon safe for families and late-night travel
faqs.answer: Yes, Sector 106 is considered very safe. It benefits from modern infrastructure planning and many rental properties are located within guarded or community-managed areas. As the area develops, police patrolling has also increased, and its excellent road network means commuting is fast and well-lit, providing significant assurance to residents and their families.

faqs.question: Are pets generally allowed in rental houses in Sector 106
faqs.answer: Pet policies vary significantly among landlords and specific rental houses. While independent houses generally offer more flexibility than apartment complexes, permission is always at the discretion of the owner. It is crucial to confirm the pet policy explicitly before finalizing the lease. Some landlords may require an additional pet deposit to cover potential damages.

faqs.question: What utility costs should I expect in addition to the rent
faqs.answer: As a tenant, you are typically responsible for electricity consumption based on actual meter readings, water usage charges often fixed or based on consumption, and cooking gas connection. If the house is within a managed community, you may also need to pay a monthly maintenance fee which covers common area upkeep, security, and sometimes backup power charges for essential services.

faqs.question: How close is Sector 106 to major office hubs like Cyber City
faqs.answer: Due to the seamless connectivity provided by the Dwarka Expressway, the distance to major hubs like Cyber City or Udyog Vihar is manageable. During peak hours, the commute can take approximately 30 to 45 minutes, a highly favorable travel time compared to other parts of New Gurgaon. This connectivity is a primary reason professionals seek to Rent House in Sector 106.

faqs.question: Are there good schools and hospitals near Sector 106
faqs.answer: Yes, the sectorâ€™s proximity to established areas means residents have access to several top educational institutions including DPS and various international schools, typically within a 15 to 20 minute drive. Reputed multi-specialty hospitals and medical centres are also located nearby, ensuring comprehensive healthcare access for all residents.

faqs.question: Can I sublet a room if I Rent House in Sector 106
faqs.answer: Subletting clauses must be explicitly discussed and approved by the landlord before signing the lease agreement. Most standard residential leases prohibit subletting without prior written consent, as the landlord needs control over who resides on their property. Always negotiate this point upfront if you anticipate needing to share the accommodation formally.
